revised_title: Effects of Electric Currents on Aqueous Solutions: Boundary Line Movements and Diffusion
tldr: The author investigates the effects of electric currents on the surfaces of mutual contact of aqueous solutions, observing that the boundary line of contact becomes indefinite when the current passes from a lighter to a heavier solution. The author also notes that reversing the current direction reverses these effects, and that electric currents can cause separation of mixed boundary layers.
